name: 倪至寬
objective: This class is intented primarily for undergraduate civil engineering students. The textbook is comprised of fourteen chapters with examples and problems and an answer section for selected problems.The chapters are mostly devoted to the geotechnical aspects of foundation design. Because the text introduces civil engineering students to the application of the fundamental concepts of foundation analysis and design, the mathematical derivations are not always presented. Instead, just the final form of the equation is given. Example problems that will help students understand the application of various equations and graphs are given in this class.
schedule:
1. Natural Soil Deposit
2. Subsoil Exploration
3. Boring Logs and Soil Testing
4. Shallow Foundation
5. Ultimate Bearing Capacity of Shallow Foundation
6. Allowable Bearing Capacity of Shallow Foundation
7. Settlement of Shallow Foundation (1/2)
8. Settlement of Shallow Foundation (2/2)
9. Midterm Exam
10. Lateral Earth Pressure (1/2)
11. Lateral Earth Pressure (2/2)
12. Retaining Wall (1/2)
13. Retaining Wall (2/2)
14. Sheet Pile Wall (1/2)
15. Sheet Pile Wall (2/2)
16. Pile Foundation (1/2)
17. Pile Foundation (2/2)
18. Final Exam
materials: Principles of Foundation Engineering by Braja M. Das
